instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .
definitions.820-2914: What is 820-2914? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVOUT_SW_LCDBKLT: What is PPVOUT_SW_LCDBKLT? PPVOUT_SW_LCDBKLT is the voltage rail for the backlight of the LCD screen. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no data or bklt
threads.message:
have a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with no data. the screen under a flashlight shows really dark.  tested the l9008 & l9004 both are good. I also replaced the lvds connector.  any ideas?
Thanks 
Nate

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no data or bklt
threads.message: Is there 3V on both L9004/8? LCD plugged in of course. Check <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no data or bklt
threads.message: yes 3v on both l9004/8 and a solid 3v on the smc lid.  when i turn it on the screen reacts and makes the light become hard to see through the glass. if i turn it off i can see my light very well. this is the same thing im getting with the other board i have the <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>.  what would make the screen turn dark to the point where my flashlight cannot show through it very well?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no data or bklt
threads.message: Voltage on backlight bus to LCD connector?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no data or bklt
threads.message:
im getting 3.2v <SIGNAL>PPBUS_SW_LCDBKLT_PWR_SW</SIGNAL> 12.4v 

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_SW_LCD</SIGNAL> im getting 3.4v.  is this what u wanted im not 100% sure were i should test for the backlight bus to lcd con.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no data or bklt
threads.message: Backlight is not boosting. Read sticky on backlight repair, this has been gone over a million times now.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no data or bklt
threads.message:
came across this board in a pile.  i went over and checked the readings here and <SIGNAL>PPBUS_SW_LCDBKLT_PWR_SW</SIGNAL> = 12.4v  this is good right? 

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_SW_LCD</SIGNAL> im getting 3.4v.

and on <SIGNAL>PPVOUT_SW_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL> im getting 27v and this is good also.  i am noticing you said that the backlight is not boosting but with 27v does that not mean the back light is fully boosted?  i get a faint screen light and know the backlight has turned on but not at full brightness, also i am getting no data or logo but i get a nice long dong.  could this have to do with the gmux or perhaps the graphics?  i checked the pwm and getting 3.4v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no data or bklt
threads.message: Check all LVDS lines on diode mode.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no data or bklt
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no data or bklt
threads.message: Looks fine. If the backlight is preset and there is just a black screen with backlight. Try another LCD assemble, inspect connector.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no data or bklt
threads.message: i'm getting a black screen with backlight. just tried replacing the connector and tried swapping out the screen, no change.  i tested the screen on a working board and the screen is working.  there are some red points around the connector and <CHIP>U9701</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no data or bklt
threads.message: Either bad connector/soldering/wrong connector or a dead PCH.
